upload_request_full_short.subject: IEEE VIS 2024 Upload Request
upload_request_full_short.body_text:
Dear {Contributor(s)},

Congratulations once again on the acceptance to VIS 2024 of your paper with the unique submission ID {UID}, entitled {Title}.

As per the instructions you received in the final acceptance email, the final camera ready papers and supplemental materials are to be uploaded via the PCS submission system by August 8.  Please expect an email after you complete your camera-ready submission with additional instructions on how to complete the copyright release form. This will be handled via IEEE’s Conference Publishing Services (IEEE CPS) via a link provided to you via email.
We also kindly remind you that the early registration period for IEEE VIS 2024 lasts until September 1. All papers are required to have one author register as a speaker, irrespective of whether they plan to present in person or virtually, and must be presented by that person: https://ieeevis.org/year/2024/info/registration/conference-registration
This email contains instructions concerning the upload of additional submission items required (video preview and representative image). Two pieces that require your action are listed below, please read carefully and follow the links to finalize your submission. Detailed information and instructions regarding the preparation of all items listed are available here: https://ieeevis.org/year/2024/info/presenter-information/final-information-paper-authors.

Please use the following link to upload the requested four files via our Presentation Material Upload system:
  {PMU Upload Link}
1. Video Preview. Please upload your mandatory 25-second video preview and subtitle file via the provided Upload link. The link is specific for material relating to your presentation with submission ID {UID}. Instructions regarding the creation of the video preview are available here: https://ieeevis.org/year/2024/info/presenter-information/fast-forward-and-video-previews
2. Representative Image. As described in the talk recording guide https://ieeevis.org/year/2024/info/presenter-information/talk-guide, it is also required for authors to submit a representative image, with a brief caption, for use as an icon on the conference web pages.

The deadline for the video preview and representative image is August 22, 11:59pm (23:59) Anywhere on Earth (AoE).
After uploading a file, we perform various initial checks automatically. If any errors are reported, you must fix the raised issues before the respective deadline. We also encourage you to strongly consider any warnings that might be displayed.
Please carefully go through and complete the list of tasks by the above given deadlines. If you have any questions don’t hesitate to contact the tech chairs at tech@ieeevis.org.

Best regards,
IEEE VIS 2024 Tech Chairs
Aditeya Pandey, John Thompson, Harry Li, Kelvin Li
upload_request_full_short.body_html:
IEEE VIS 2024 Upload Request

https://ieeevis.org/

Dear {Contributor(s)},

Congratulations once again on the acceptance to VIS 2024 of your paper with the unique submission ID {UID}, entitled “{Title}”.

As per the instructions you received in the final acceptance email, the final camera ready papers and supplemental materials are to be uploaded via the PCS submission system by August 8. Please expect an email after you complete your camera-ready submission with additional instructions on how to complete the copyright release form. This will be handled via IEEE’s Conference Publishing Services (IEEE CPS) via a link provided to you via email.

We also kindly remind you that the early registration period for IEEE VIS 2024 lasts until September 1. All papers are required to have one author register as a speaker, irrespective of whether they plan to present in person or virtually, and must be presented by that person: https://ieeevis.org/year/2024/info/registration/conference-registration.

This email contains instructions concerning the upload of additional submission items required (video preview and representative image). Two pieces that require your action are listed below, please read carefully and follow the links to finalize your submission. Detailed information and instructions regarding the preparation of all items listed are available here: https://ieeevis.org/year/2024/info/presenter-information/final-information-paper-authors

Please use the following link to upload the requested four files via our Presentation Material Upload system:

{PMU Upload Link}

  1. Video Preview

    Please upload your mandatory 25-second video preview and subtitle file via the provided Upload link. The link is specific for material relating to your presentation with submission ID {UID}. Instructions regarding the creation of the video preview are available here: https://ieeevis.org/year/2024/info/presenter-information/fast-forward-and-video-previews.

  2. Representative Image

    As described in the talk recording guide (https://ieeevis.org/year/2024/info/presenter-information/talk-guide), it is also required for authors to submit a representative image, with a brief caption, for use as an icon on the conference web pages.

The deadline for the video preview and representative image is August 22, 11:59pm (23:59) Anywhere on Earth (AoE).

After uploading a file, we perform various initial checks automatically. If any errors are reported, you must fix the raised issues before the respective deadline. We also encourage you to strongly consider any warnings that might be displayed.

Please carefully go through and complete the list of tasks by the above given deadlines. If you have any questions don’t hesitate to contact the tech chairs at tech@ieeevis.org.

Best regards,

IEEE VIS 2024 Tech Chairs

Aditeya Pandey, John Thompson, Harry Li, and Kelvin Li

upload_request_tvcg_cga.subject: IEEE VIS 2024 Upload Request
upload_request_tvcg_cga.body_text:
Dear {Contributor(s)},

Congratulations once again on the acceptance of your invited VIS 2024 presentation. This email provides instructions for uploading materials to the conference. For administrative purposes, we have assigned you a unique submission ID, {UID}, for your paper “{Title}”.

We kindly remind you that the early registration period for IEEE VIS 2024 lasts until September 1. All papers are required to have one author register as a speaker, irrespective of whether they plan to present in person or virtually, and must be presented by that person: https://ieeevis.org/year/2024/info/registration/conference-registration

This email contains instructions concerning the upload of additional submission items required (video preview and representative image) as well as some additional information needed. Three pieces that require your action are listed below, please read carefully and follow the links to finalize your submission. Detailed information and instructions regarding the preparation of all items listed are available here: https://ieeevis.org/year/2024/info/presenter-information/final-information-paper-authors.
Please use the following link to upload the requested four files via our Presentation Material Upload system:
{PMU Upload Link}

1. Video Preview (and Subtitle). Please upload your mandatory 25-second video preview and subtitle file via the provided Upload link. The link is specific for material relating to your presentation with submission ID {UID}. Instructions regarding the creation of the video preview are available here: https://ieeevis.org/year/2024/info/presenter-information/fast-forward-and-video-previews

2. Representative Image (and Caption). As described in the talk recording guide https://ieeevis.org/year/2024/info/presenter-information/talk-guide, it is also required for authors to submit a representative image, for use as an icon on the conference web pages. Accompanying the image, authors should submit a brief caption as a plaintext file (*.txt). 
The deadline for the video preview, subtitles, representative image, and caption is September 12, 11:59pm (23:59) Anywhere on Earth (AoE).

After uploading a file, we perform various initial checks automatically. If any errors are reported, you must fix the raised issues before the respective deadline. We also encourage you to strongly consider any warnings that might be displayed.

3. Author Information Form. Additional information regarding your paper presentation and publication is needed to help the organizing committee plan the program. Please visit this link and complete the corresponding form: https://forms.gle/hw3tsAgokKvjD7jo9
Please use your submission ID: {UID} when filling in the form. The deadline for completing the form is September 12, 11:59pm (23:59) Anywhere on Earth (AoE).

Please carefully go through and complete the list of tasks by the above given deadlines. If you have any questions, don’t hesitate to contact the tech chairs at tech@ieeevis.org.
 
Best regards,
IEEE VIS 2024 Tech Chairs
Aditeya Pandey, John Thompson, Harry Li, Kelvin Li

upload_request_associated_event.subject: IEEE VIS 2024 Upload Request
upload_request_associated_event.body_text:
Dear {Contributor(s)},

Congratulations once again on the acceptance of your {Event} presentation. This email provides instructions for uploading materials to the conference. For administrative purposes, we have assigned you a unique submission ID, {UID}, for your paper “{Title}”.
We also kindly remind you that the early registration period for IEEE VIS 2024 lasts until September 1. Speakers with papers at associated events are expected to register but are only required to register as attendees (not speakers), either in-person or virtual: https://ieeevis.org/year/2024/info/registration/conference-registration

For papers that will be published in IEEE Xplore, authors are asked to complete a copyright release form. This will be handled via IEEE’s Conference Publishing Services (IEEE CPS) via a link provided to you via email. Note that not all associated events have their papers published in IEEE Xplore. If you are unsure about the publishing process for {Event}, please contact the organizers.

This email contains instructions concerning the upload of submission items (video preview and representative image) as well as some additional information needed for publication. Three pieces that require your action are listed below, please read carefully and follow the links to finalize your submission. Detailed information and instructions regarding the preparation of all items listed are available here: https://ieeevis.org/year/2024/info/presenter-information/final-information-paper-authors.
Please use the following link to upload the requested four files via our Presentation Material Upload system:
  {PMU Upload Link}
1. Video Preview and Subtitle [Optional]. Please upload your optional 25-second video preview and subtitle file via the provided Upload link. The link is specific for material relating to your presentation with submission ID {UID}. Instructions regarding the creation of the video preview are available here:  https://ieeevis.org/year/2024/info/presenter-information/fast-forward-and-video-previews

2. Representative Image and Caption [Required]. As described in the talk recording guide https://ieeevis.org/year/2024/info/presenter-information/talk-guide, it is required for authors to submit a representative image, for use as an icon on the conference web pages. Accompanying the image, authors should submit a brief caption as a plaintext file (*.txt).

The deadline for the video preview and representative image is October 11, 11:59pm (23:59) Anywhere on Earth (AoE).
After uploading a file, we perform various initial checks automatically. If any errors are reported, you must fix the raised issues before the respective deadline. We also encourage you to strongly consider any warnings that might be displayed.

3. Author Information Form [Required]. Additional information regarding your paper presentation and publication is needed to help the organizing committee plan the program.

Please visit this link and complete the corresponding form: https://forms.gle/hw3tsAgokKvjD7jo9 Please use your submission ID: {UID} when filling in the form. The deadline for completing the form is October 11, 11:59pm (23:59) Anywhere on Earth (AoE).

Please carefully go through and complete the list of tasks by the above given deadlines. If you have any questions, don’t hesitate to contact the tech chairs at tech@ieeevis.org.

Best regards,
IEEE VIS 2024 Tech Chairs
Aditeya Pandey, John Thompson, Harry Li, Kelvin Li

attendee_info.subject: Welcome to IEEE VIS 2024
attendee_info.body_text:
Welcome to IEEE VIS 2024

IMPORTANT NOTICE: IEEE VIS 2024 will now be fully virtual.

Dear {name},

Thank you for registering for VIS 2024! We are excited to welcome you to the IEEE VIS 2024 Conference, running from October 13 - 18 as a virtual event. The conference will provide access to the VIS community around the world with: YouTube streaming of virtual presentations hosted on Zoom, sli.do for question + answering, and downloadable proceedings. If you are a presenter, organizer, or session chair you can find information about the  technical setup here: https://ieeevis.org/year/2024/info/presenter-information/virtual-technical-information.

This year, all the conference’s content is available from the VIS website, https://ieeevis.org/year/2024/welcome.  From that page, on the Content bar, you can view the conference schedule, see a list of all events, accepted papers, and posters, and find the awards that will be given out this year.  Live streamed sessions are accessible by navigating to the room page in which the session is taking place.  You can get to a live streamed session by finding the session on the schedule page.

Accessing streaming pages and all downloadable content, including paper and poster images, PDFs, and supplemental material, requires a conference registration.  This email contains your login information for this content. Log in using the Login button at the top of the page.  

Username: {email}
Password: {password}

You are invited to Discord for informal discussions and exchange.

Discord Invite: {discord_invite_url}

If you have any additional questions, please don’t hesitate to email the Tech chairs:
tech@ieeevis.org.

Best regards,
IEEE VIS 2024 Tech Chairs
John Thompson, Aditeya Pandey, Kelvin Li, and Harry Li

session_chair_organizer_info.subject: VIS 2024 Session Chair and Event Organizer Information
session_chair_organizer_info.body_text:
VIS 2024 Session Chair or Event Organizer Information
IEEE VIS 2024 will now be fully virtual. 
Dear Chair or Organizer,
This email contains information for the virtual conference session titled: **{Session Title}**, in which you are a chair or organizer. You will receive one such email per session and/or tutorial. All session details (URLs, Zooms, etc.) are at the end of this email. But read the entire email carefully!
**Note for Panels:** Please forward this email on to your panelists if any are missing.
**Note for Workshop/Associated Events:** Please forward this email to organizers if any are missing who need this Zoom information. Please submit additional presenters that are not listed in the Run-of-Show app (see below).
Please see below corresponding information for either **Event Organizers** or **Session Chairs**

## Information for Event Organizers 
Below is a list of the virtual technical capabilities that will be available for your event. All of these capabilities will be used by default. Event organizers should communicate to the Tech Chairs if any capabilities should not be used. These capabilities include: 
Presenters can share screen, video, and audio as participants in the IEEE VIS provided Zoom Meeting. 
Streaming of the entire Zoom Meeting session to a live YouTube broadcast. The YouTube stream will appear unlisted on the ieeevis.org page for the session. After the conference ends, an edited version of the recording will be made public on the IEEE VIS YouTube Channel.
Discord channel for discussion.
Sli.do channel for Q+A.

__Speaker Registration__ **Please note that all presenters must register for the conference. The registration includes a video release form that is needed to be included in the conference sessions.** For that reason we cannot allow switching speakers, unless they are registered. Without their consent via registration, we cannot legally share, post, or stream a talk. We understand that with the change to a virtual format, some speakers might choose not to present anymore (e.g., due to time zone differences). However, we would like to make it clear that, unless the new speaker has provided consent, we cannot allow for the switch. 

__Event Schedule__ We do not have a detailed schedule of your event, only the accepted papers or posters. Once an A/V Student Volunteer is assigned to your session, you will receive an email with their assignment. Please send the Student Volunteer a version of your event schedule (e.g., on the event website, a spreadsheet, etc.) The Audio-Visual SV will need a schedule to know which presenter to spotlight in the Zoom Meeting.

__Submit Additional Presenters__ In order for all presenters to receive presentation instructions from IEEE VIS, we ask that you submit any additional presenters (e.g., keynote speakers, panelists). As stated above, we do not have a complete list of presenters for your event. We only have presenters that have accepted submissions via PCS. In the Run-of-Show app you can find a list of the presentations and their respective presenters.

Run-of-Show app: {RoS URL}

**Email tech@ieeevis.org with a list of names and emails are format in a list separated by the “|” character. Please follow this format, it will save us valuable time.** If your event includes two sessions (BELIV and EduVis only) - please send us two lists, one for each session. Once your Additional Presenters list has been submitted, their names should be listed in the Run-of-Show app.

For Example:
Presenter Names: Name One|Name Two|Name Three
Additional Presenter Emails: email_one@gmail.com|email_two@gmail.com|email_three@gmail.com



__Session Time Change.__ Due to the transition to a virtual conference. There have been a number of time adjustments to the schedule. Please double check your session time, as it might have changed. Please contact your invited speakers to make sure that they are aware of the venue change and that they are registered to log into the virtual conference. All registered VIS attendees should have received emails regarding the change in VIS to a virtual format.

__Technical Difficulties.__ Please contact the presenters of your session/workshop/panel and ask for pre-recorded videos of their talk in case of technical difficulties (e.g., bad internet connection, no-shows, etc.). How to run your session/workshop/panel is up to you, but our recommendation is that if a presenter cannot present effectively (and there's no pre-recorded video available), you should skip the presentation and move on to the next.

__At the end of your session.__ There is a hard cut-off 10 minutes after the session is scheduled to end to allow time to set up the next session, so please keep to the session schedule. We have a limited number of Zoom licenses, and another Zoom Meeting will be taking place after your session. Additional discussion after the session should be directed to continue on Discord.

## Information for Session Chairs

Please join the session Zoom Meeting 15 minutes before the session to test A/V setups with your presenters. Please also check in with your assisting Audio-Visual Student Volunteer. During the session, the session chair should indicate when it is time to wrap up the presentations.

__As the Chair.__  You can read the paper and watch any preview videos before your session in the Run-of-Show app (see below). You'll be responsible for introducing the talk, keeping time, and handling the live Q&A. Please watch the video [HowTo: chair a session at VIS](https://youtu.be/pWygXAH-9FE) for tips and tricks.

__Live Virtual Q&A.__ After each talk there will be a live Q&A portion, depending on the session structure (associated events and workshops may vary). As the chair, you will field questions virtually from Sli.do. You can select questions from Sli.do and should read them aloud so that they are recorded on the live stream. Please note that there will be a slight delay (around 20 seconds) between the Zoom meeting and Youtube stream. **As session chair, please prepare a first question for each presentation to give the audience some time to produce questions.** 

__Session Time Change.__ Due to the transition to a virtual conference. There have been a number of time adjustments to the schedule. Please double check your session time, as it might have changed.

__Technical Difficulties.__ Please contact the presenters of your session and ask for pre-recorded videos of their talk in case of technical difficulties (e.g., bad internet connection, no-shows, etc.). How to run your session is up to you, but our recommendation is that in the case where the presenter cannot present effectively (and there's no pre-recorded video available), you should skip the presentation and move on to the next.

__At the end of your session.__ There is a hard cut-off 10 minutes after the session is scheduled to end to allow time to set up the next session, so please keep to the session schedule. We have a limited number of Zoom licenses, and another Zoom Meeting will be taking place after your session. Additional discussion after the session should be directed to continue on Discord.


## Session Information

* Session Name: {Session Title}
* Session Page: [Conference Website](https://ieeevis.org/year/2024/program/session_{Session ID}.html)
* Session Start: {DateTime Start} (UTC+0)
* Session End: {DateTime End} (UTC+0)
* Session Chairs: {Session Chairs}
* Session Chairs Emails: {Session Chairs Emails}
* Session Room: {Room Name}
* Session YouTube Broadcast: {Session YouTube URL}
## Zoom Meeting Information (Please DO NOT SHARE publicly.)
The Zoom Meeting URL includes the embedded password. We include the Meeting Password below just in case.
* Private Meeting URL: {Zoom URL}
* Meeting ID: {Zoom Meeting ID}
* Meeting Password: {Zoom Password}
## Virtual Discussion and Q&A Information
* Discord Room: {Discord URL}
* Slido Room: {Slido URL}

## Run-of-Show (DO NOT SHARE publicly)
We have a Run-of-Show app that will help you by providing all the information you might need for running a session or event in one central place. If you are chairing or hosting a workshop, tutorial, or associated event, please note that the schedule might be incomplete.

Run-of-Show app: {RoS URL}

## Virtual Technical Information
You can find additional information about the virtual presentations here: https://ieeevis.org/year/2024/info/presenter-information/virtual-technical-information
If you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to email the Tech chairs:
tech@ieeevis.org.
 
Best regards,
IEEE VIS 2024 Tech Chairs
John Thompson, Aditeya Pandey, Kelvin Li, and Harry Li
session_chair_organizer_info.body_html:
VIS 2024 Session Chair and Event Organizer Information

https://ieeevis.org/

Dear Chair or Organizer,

This email contains information for the virtual conference session titled: {Session Title}, in which you are a chair or organizer. You will receive one such email per session and/or tutorial. All session details (URLs, Zooms, etc.) are at the end of this email. But read the entire email carefully!

  2. Streaming of the entire Zoom Meeting session to a live YouTube broadcast. The YouTube stream will appear unlisted on yoursession's web page. After the conference ends, an edited version of the recording will be made public on the IEEE VIS YouTube Channel.

  3. Discord channel for discussion.

For that reason we cannot allow switching speakers, unless they are registered. Without their consent via registration, we cannot legally share, post, or stream a talk. We understand that with the change to a virtual format, some speakers might choose not to present anymore (e.g., due to time zone differences). Event Schedule. We do not have a detailed schedule of your event, only the accepted papers or posters. Once an A/V Student Volunteer is assigned to your session, you will receive an email with their assignment. Please send the Student Volunteer a version of your event schedule (e.g., on the event website, a spreadsheet, etc.) The A/V SV will need a schedule to know which presenter to spotlight in the Zoom Meeting.

Submit Additional Presenters. In order for all presenters to receive presentation instructions from IEEE VIS, we ask that you submit any additional presenters (e.g., keynote speakers, panelists). As stated above, we do not have a complete list of presenters for your event. We only have presenters that have accepted submissions via PCS. In the Run-of-Show app you can find a list of the presentations and their respective presenters.

Run-of-Show App: {RoS URL}

Email tech@ieeevis.org with a list of names and emails separated by the “|” character. Please follow this format, it will save us valuable time. If your event includes two sessions (BELIV and EduVis only) - please send us two lists, one for each session. Once your Additional Presenters list has been submitted, their names should be listed in the Run-of-Show app.

For Example:

Presenter Names: Name One|Name Two|Name Three

Additional Presenter Emails: email_one@gmail.com|email_two@gmail.com|email_three@gmail.com

Session Time Change. Due to the transition to a virtual conference. There have been a number of time adjustments to the schedule. Please double check your session time, as it might have changed. Please contact your invited speakers to make sure that they are aware of the venue change and that they are registered to log into the virtual conference. All registered VIS attendees should have received emails regarding the change in VIS to a virtual format.

Technical Difficulties. Please contact the presenters of your session/workshop/panel and ask for pre-recorded videos of their talk in case of technical difficulties (e.g., bad internet connection, no-shows, etc.). How to run your session/workshop/panel is up to you, but our recommendation is that if a presenter cannot present effectively (and there's no pre-recorded video available), you should skip the presentation and move on to the next.

At the end of your session. There is a hard cut-off 10 minutes after the session is scheduled to end to allow time to set up the next session, so please keep to the session schedule. We have a limited number of Zoom licenses, and another Zoom Meeting will be taking place after your session. Additional discussion after the session should be directed to continue on Discord.

Information for Session Chairs

Please join the session Zoom Meeting 15 minutes before the session to test A/V setups with your presenters. Please also check in with your assisting A/V Student Volunteer. During the session, the session chair should indicate when it is time to wrap up the presentations.

As the Chair. You can read the paper and watch any preview videos before your session in the Run-of-Show app (see below). You'll be responsible for introducing the talk, keeping time, and handling the live Q&A. Please watch the video HowTo: chair a session at VIS for tips and tricks.

Live Virtual Q&A. After each talk there will be a live Q&A portion, depending on the session structure (associated events and workshops may vary). As the chair, you will field questions virtually from Sli.do. You can select questions from Sli.do and should read them aloud so that they are recorded on the live stream. Please note that there will be a slight delay (around 20 seconds) between the Zoom meeting and Youtube stream. As session chair, please prepare a first question for each presentation to give the audience some time to produce questions.

Session Time Change. Due to the transition to a virtual conference. There have been a number of time adjustments to the schedule. Please double check your session time, as it might have changed.

Technical Difficulties. Please contact the presenters of your session and ask for pre-recorded videos of their talk in case of technical difficulties (e.g., bad internet connection, no-shows, etc.). How to run your session is up to you, but our recommendation is that in the case where the presenter cannot present effectively (and there's no pre-recorded video available), you should skip the presentation and move on to the next.

At the end of your session. There is a hard cut-off 10 minutes after the session is scheduled to end to allow time to set up the next session, so please keep to the session schedule. We have a limited number of Zoom licenses, and another Zoom Meeting will be taking place after your session. Additional discussion after the session should be directed to continue on Discord.

Session Information

Session: {Session Title}

Session Start: {DateTime Start} (UTC+0)

Session End: {DateTime End} (UTC+0)

Session Chairs: {Session Chairs}

Session Chairs Emails: {Session Chairs Emails}

Session Web Page: https://ieeevis.org/year/2024/program/session_{Session ID}.html

Session YouTube Broadcast: {Session YouTube URL}

Session Room: {Room Name}

Zoom Meeting Information

DO NOT SHARE publicly

The Zoom Meeting URL includes the embedded password. We spell out the Meeting Password below just in case.

Private Meeting URL: {Zoom URL}

Meeting ID: {Zoom Meeting ID}

Meeting Password: {Zoom Password}

Virtual Discussion and Q&A Information

Discord Room: {Discord URL}

Slido Room: {Slido URL}

Run-of-Show App

DO NOT SHARE publicly

We have a Run-of-Show app that will help you by providing all the information you might need for running a session or event in one central place. If you are chairing or hosting a workshop, tutorial, or associated event, please note that the schedule might be incomplete.

Run-of-Show App: {RoS URL}

Virtual Technical Information

You can find additional information about the virtual presentations here: https://ieeevis.org/year/2024/info/presenter-information/virtual-technical-information .

If you have any questions don’t hesitate to contact the tech chairs at tech@ieeevis.org.

Best regards,

IEEE VIS 2024 Tech Chairs

Aditeya Pandey, John Thompson, Harry Li, and Kelvin Li

presenter_info.subject: VIS 2024 Presenter Information
presenter_info.body_text:
VIS 2024 Presenter Information
IEEE VIS 2024 will now be fully virtual. 
Dear Presenter,
This email contains information for a VIS 2024 conference session where you are scheduled to present virtually. You will receive one such email per session.
If you are the contact author, but not the presenter, **please forward this immediately to the presenting author**.
This email contains a Zoom link for you to virtually present in the session. **Please DO NOT SHARE this link publicly.**

__Session to Present In: {Session Title}__

##Instructions
__Preparing for your virtual presentation.__ Virtual presentations will take place over a live Zoom Meeting - with presenters sharing their screen, camera, and audio over Zoom. The same Zoom Meeting will be used for earlier and later sessions that day, so please do not join the Zoom other than 15 minutes prior to your session. If you encounter any issues, a Student Volunteer will be the host of the Zoom or you can message our support team via the [#support Discord channel](https://discord.com/channels/1286338967674818684/1286346968674598964). You can also contact the Session Chair for help (see contact info below).

During the conference, only the presenters, the session chair, and an SV will be on the Zoom call. We'll be streaming live to Youtube. The session chair will keep everything on track with timing for talks and will monitor Sli.do for questions from the audience. When your talk portion ends, the session chair will act as moderator and ask you questions from the audience. Please make sure to check the program and connect with your session chair in advance if possible.


__Checklist for your virtual presentation:__
Ensure you have an adequate internet connection for your presentation: 7.5Mbps/5.0Mbps (up/down).
Install Zoom Desktop before your session.
Create and log in to your Zoom account (can be any school or personal account).
Grant Zoom [permissions for macOS](https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0064868). Zoom needs permissions for “Camera”, “Microphone”, and “Screen and System Audio Recording.”
If presenting with system audio (i.e. you intend to play a video with sound during your presentation), be sure to [share computer audio when sharing your screen](https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0063608#h_01GBXFBZ8GBD3Z3YV70YRETA7Y). 
Test connection and screen sharing. Join the Zoom Meeting for your session 15 minutes prior to the start.
Mute yourself and turn off the video while others are presenting.
Do not listen, or watch the YouTube live broadcast during your session as this might cause an audio feedback loop.
__Q&A.__ After each talk there will be a live Q&A portion, depending on the session structure (associated events and workshops may vary). The session chair will be in the room and take questions virtually via Sli.do.

__At the end of your session.__ There is a hard cut-off 10 minutes after the session is scheduled to end to allow time to set up the next session, so please keep to the session schedule. Additional discussion after the session can be continued on Discord.

## Session Information

* Session Name: {Session Title}
* Session Start: {DateTime Start} (EDT UTC+0)
* Session End: {DateTime End} (EDT UTC+0)
* Session Chairs: {Session Chairs}
* Session Chairs Emails: {Session Chairs Emails}
* Session Page: [Conference Website](https://ieeevis.org/year/2024/program/session_{Session ID}.html)
* Session YouTube Broadcast: {Session YouTube URL}
* Session Room: {Room Name}
## Zoom Meeting Information
**Please DO NOT SHARE.**
The Zoom Meeting URL includes the embedded password. We include the Meeting Password below just in case.
* Private Meeting URL: {Zoom URL}
* Meeting ID: {Zoom Meeting ID}
* Meeting Password: {Zoom Password}
## Virtual Discussion and Q&A Information
* Discord Room: {Discord URL}
* Slido Room: {Slido URL}
## Virtual Technical Information for Presenters
You can find additional information about the virtual presentations here: https://ieeevis.org/year/2024/info/presenter-information/virtual-technical-information
If you have any additional questions, please don’t hesitate to email the Tech chairs:
tech@ieeevis.org.
 
Best regards,
IEEE VIS 2024 Tech Chairs
John Thompson, Aditeya Pandey, Kelvin Li, and Harry Li
presenter_info.body_html:
VIS 2024 Presenter Information

https://ieeevis.org/

IEEE VIS 2024 will now be fully virtual.

Dear Presenter,

This email contains information for a VIS 2024 conference session where you are scheduled to present virtually. You will receive one such email per session.

If you are the contact author, but not the presenter, please forward this immediately to the presenting author.

This email contains a Zoom link for you to virtually present in the session. Please DO NOT SHARE this link publicly.

Session to Present In: {Session Title}

Instructions

Preparing for your virtual presentation. Virtual presentations will take place over a live Zoom Meeting - with presenters sharing their screen, camera, and audio over Zoom. The same Zoom Meeting will be used for earlier and later sessions that day, so please do not join the Zoom other than 15 minutes prior to your session. If you encounter any issues, a Student Volunteer will be the host of the Zoom or you can message our support team via the #Support Discord Channel. You can also contact the Session Chair for help (see contact info below).

During the conference, only the presenters, the session chair, and an SV will be on the Zoom call. We'll be streaming live to Youtube. The session chair will keep everything on track with timing for talks and will monitor Sli.do for questions from the audience. When your talk portion ends, the session chair will act as moderator and ask you questions from the audience. Please make sure to check the program and connect with your session chair in advance if possible.

Checklist for your virtual presentation

  1. Ensure you have an adequate internet connection for your presentation: 7.5Mbps/5.0Mbps (up/down).

  2. Install Zoom Desktop before your session.

  3. Create and log in to your Zoom account (can be any school or personal account).

  4. Grant Zoom permissions for macOS. Zoom needs permissions for “Camera”, “Microphone”, and “Screen and System Audio Recording.”

  5. If presenting with system audio (i.e. you intend to play a video with sound during your presentation), be sure to share computer audio when sharing your screen.

  6. Test connection and screen sharing. Join the Zoom Meeting for your session 15 minutes prior to the start.

  7. Mute yourself and turn off the video while others are presenting.

  8. Do not listen, or watch the YouTube live broadcast during your session as this might cause an audio feedback loop.

Q&A. After each talk there will be a live Q&A portion, depending on the session structure (associated events and workshops may vary). The session chair will be in the room and take questions virtually via Sli.do.

At the end of your session. There is a hard cut-off 10 minutes after the session is scheduled to end to allow time to set up the next session, so please keep to the session schedule. Additional discussion after the session can be continued on Discord.

Session Room: {Room Name}

Meeting ID: {Zoom Meeting ID}

Meeting Password: {Zoom Password}

Virtual Discussion and Q&A Information

Discord Room: {Discord URL}

Slido Room: {Slido URL}

Virtual Technical Information

You can find additional information about the virtual presentations here: https://ieeevis.org/year/2024/info/presenter-information/virtual-technical-information .

If you have any questions don’t hesitate to contact the tech chairs at tech@ieeevis.org.

Best regards,
